008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.ellipse.algebraic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.AlgebraicEllipse;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019/**
020 * Interface for algebraic ellipse fits.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 */
024public interface EllipseFitAlgebraic {
025        
026        public enum FitType {
027                FitzgibbonNaive,
028                FitzgibbonOriginal,
029                FitzgibbonStable,
030                Taubin1,
031                Taubin2
032        }
033        
034        public static EllipseFitAlgebraic getFit(FitType type, Pnt2d[] points, Pnt2d xref) {
035                switch (type) {
036                case FitzgibbonNaive:           return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonNaive(points);
037                case FitzgibbonOriginal:        return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonOriginal(points);
038                case FitzgibbonStable:          return new EllipseFitFitzgibbonStable(points, xref);
039                case Taubin1:                           return new EllipseFitTaubin1(points, xref);
040                case Taubin2:                           return new EllipseFitTaubin2(points, xref);
041                }
042                throw new RuntimeException("unknown algebraic fit type: " + type);
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Returns a vector of algebraic ellipse parameters:
047         * {@code (a,b,c,d,e,f)}, representing the ellipse by
048         * {@code a x^2 + b x y + c y^2 + d x + e y + f = 0}.
049         * @return the ellipse parameters
050         */
051        public double[] getParameters();
052        
053        /**
054         * Returns a algebraic ellipse constructed from the 
055         * estimated ellipse parameters.
056         * 
057         * @return an {@link AlgebraicEllipse} instance
058         */
059        public default AlgebraicEllipse getEllipse() {
060                double[] p = getParameters();
061                return (p == null) ? null : new AlgebraicEllipse(p);
062        }
063        
064        public default boolean isEllipse() {
065                double[] p = getParameters();   // p = (a,b,c,d,e,f)
066                if (p == null) {
067                        return false;
068                }
069                else {
070                        double a = p[0];
071                        double b = p[1];
072                        double c = p[2];
073                        return (sqr(b) - 4*a*c) < 0;
074                }
075        }
076        
077        /**
078         * <p>
079         * Returns a 6x6 matrix (U) to convert ellipse parameters qr = (ar,...,fr)
080         * calculated for data centered at (xr, yr) to ellipse parameters q = (a,...,f)
081         * for the original non-centered data: q = U * qr. See [1, Sec. 11.2.1] (e.g.,
082         * Alg. 11.6) for additional information.
083         * </p>
084         * <p>
085         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
086         * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
087         * </p>
088         * 
089         * @param xr data reference point (x)
090         * @param yr data reference point (y)
091         * @return the offset correction matrix (U)
092         */
093        public default RealMatrix getDataOffsetCorrectionMatrix(double xr, double yr) {
094                return Matrix.makeRealMatrix(6, 6,
095                                1,       0,     0,        0,   0,  0 ,
096                                0,       1,     0,        0,   0,  0 ,
097                                0,       0,     1,        0,   0,  0 ,
098                           -2*xr,   -yr,    0,        1,   0,  0 ,
099                                0,      -xr,   -2*yr,     0,   1,  0 ,
100                                sqr(xr), xr*yr, sqr(yr), -xr, -yr, 1 );
101        }
102        
103        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
104        
105        public static void main(String[] args) {
106                Pnt2d p1 = Pnt2d.from(31, 90);
107                Pnt2d p2 = Pnt2d.from(79, 25);
108                Pnt2d p3 = Pnt2d.from(159, 31);
109                Pnt2d p4 = Pnt2d.from(174, 55);
110                Pnt2d p5 = Pnt2d.from(173, 84);
111                Pnt2d p6 = Pnt2d.from(135, 114);
112                
113                Pnt2d[] pts = {p1, p2, p3, p4, p5, p6};
114                Pnt2d xr = Pnt2d.from(100,100);
115                
116                for (FitType type : FitType.values()) {
117                        EllipseFitAlgebraic fit = EllipseFitAlgebraic.getFit(type, pts, xr);
118                        System.out.println(type);
119                        if (fit != null) {
120                                System.out.println(fit.getEllipse());
121                        }
122                }
123                
124        }
125
126
127}
